docs.lead_paragraph: Bacteria resistant to antibiotics have now spread to every part of the world and might lead to a future where minor infections could kill, according to a report published Wednesday by the World Health Organization.

headline.main: Drug Resistance Found Worldwide, New Drugs Needed
headline.print_headline: Drug Resistance Found Worldwide, New Drugs Needed

docs.snippet: Bacteria resistant to antibiotics have now spread to every part of the world and might lead to a future where minor infections could kill, according to a report published Wednesday by the World Health Organization.

docs.lead_paragraph: Scientists have found that genes are still emerging. Now they’re trying to see why some quickly take on essential tasks, and others fall to the wayside.
docs.abstract: Several new studies examining origin of genes have determined that while some genes are immensely old, others have emerged in past few million years; scientists have found that new genes can emerge rapidly and take on essential functions soon after evolving; study of new genes may help researchers understand their roles in diseases like cancer.
docs.snippet: Scientists have found that genes are still emerging. Now they’re trying to see why some quickly take on essential tasks, and others fall to the wayside.

docs.lead_paragraph: Dr. Martin J. Blaser offers a warning against the excessive use of antibiotics, saying it has distorted our internal microbial world, eliminating good bacteria and leading to various diseases.

headline.seo: ‘Missing Microbes’: How Antibiotics Can Do Harm
headline.main: We Kill Germs at Our Peril
headline.print_headline: We Kill Germs at Our Peril

docs.abstract: Dr Abigail Zuger reviews book Missing Microbes: How the Overuse of Antibiotics is Fueling Our Modern Plagues by Dr Martin J Blaser.
docs.snippet: Dr. Martin J. Blaser offers a warning against the excessive use of antibiotics, saying it has distorted our internal microbial world, eliminating good bacteria and leading to various diseases.
